content.description: The mean and standard deviation of the sample data collected on continuous variable <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are <math alttext="negative 0.25" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.25</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and 0.03, respectively. The following table shows the relative frequencies of the data in the given intervals.
content.question: Interval Relative Frequency <math alttext="negative 0.34 is less than or equal to x which is less than negative 0.31" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.34</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.31</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> 0.02 <math alttext="negative 0.31 is less than or equal to x which is less than negative 0.28" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.31</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.28</mn></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> 0.15 <math alttext=" negative 0.28 is less than or equal to x which is less than negative 0.25" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.28</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.25</mn></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> 0.33 <math alttext=" negative 0.25 is less than or equal to x which is less than negative 0.22" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.25</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.22</mn></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> 0.36 <math alttext="negative 0.22 is less than or equal to x which is less than negative 0.19" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.22</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.19</mn></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> 0.11 <math alttext="negative 0.19 is less than or equal to x which is less than negative 0.16" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.19</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.16</mn></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> 0.03 Based on the table, do the data support the use of a normal model to approximate population characteristics?

choices.label: Yes, because the sum of the relative frequencies is 1.00.
Yes, because the distribution of relative frequencies is very close to the empirical rule for normal models.
No, because the values are negative and normal models are used for positive values.
No, because the distribution of relative frequencies is very far from the empirical rule for normal models.
No, because the sample size and the population parameters are not known.

content.answer: Yes, because the distribution of relative frequencies is very close to the empirical rule for normal models.
